sourcesContent:
import React from 'react'
  import { MDXTag } from '@mdx-js/tag'
  

export default ({components, ...props}) => <MDXTag name="wrapper"  components={components}><MDXTag name="h1" components={components} props={{"id":"use-views-in-your-project"}}><MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="h1" props={{"aria-hidden":true,"href":"#use-views-in-your-project"}}><MDXTag name="span" components={components} parentName="a" props={{"className":"icon-link"}}>{`#`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>{`Use Views in your project`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`If you're starting fresh (never done any React development) you might need to `}<MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="p" props={{"href":"https://github.com/viewstools/docs/blob/master/DevEnvironmentSetup.md"}}>{`setup dev environment`}</MDXTag>{`. This is a once off type of list but you will NOT be able to run any application localy on your computer without it.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h2" components={components} props={{"id":"open-source-code-driven"}}><MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="h2" props={{"aria-hidden":true,"href":"#open-source-code-driven"}}><MDXTag name="span" components={components} parentName="a" props={{"className":"icon-link"}}>{`#`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>{`Open source (code driven)`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="ol" components={components}>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ol">{`If you don't have an app, create a new one:
`}<MDXTag name="em" components={components} parentName="li">{`To make a new web or desktop app`}</MDXTag>{` run:`}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="pre" components={components}><MDXTag name="code" components={components} parentName="pre">{`npm install --global create-react-app
create-react-app my-app
`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}><MDXTag name="em" components={components} parentName="p">{`To make a new native app`}</MDXTag>{` run:`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="pre" components={components}><MDXTag name="code" components={components} parentName="pre">{`npm install --global create-react-native-app
create-react-native-app my-app
`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="ol" components={components} props={{"start":2}}>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ol">{`Add Views on it:`}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="pre" components={components}><MDXTag name="code" components={components} parentName="pre">{`npm install --global @viewstools/use
cd my-app
use-views
`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h2" components={components} props={{"id":"upgrade-the-morpher-to-a-new-major-version"}}><MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="h2" props={{"aria-hidden":true,"href":"#upgrade-the-morpher-to-a-new-major-version"}}><MDXTag name="span" components={components} parentName="a" props={{"className":"icon-link"}}>{`#`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>{`Upgrade the Morpher to a new major version`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`When a new major version of the Morpher is released you can run this command to upgrade`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}><MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="p">{`yarn add --dev @viewstools/morph`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`We announce updates in the our Slack community `}<MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="p" props={{"href":"https://slack.views.tools/"}}>{`Join`}</MDXTag>{` and you can find on `}<MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="p" props={{"href":"https://www.npmjs.com/package/@viewstools/morph"}}>{`NPM Package`}</MDXTag>{` `}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`To help you with updating your project to the latest changes we release `}<MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="p" props={{"href":"https://github.com/viewstools/codemods"}}>{`Code Modes`}</MDXTag>{` together with major upgrades of the Morpher.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`To check what version of the morpher you are on use
`}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="p">{`npx views-morph --version`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h2" components={components} props={{"id":"preview-your-build-online-via-surge"}}><MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="h2" props={{"aria-hidden":true,"href":"#preview-your-build-online-via-surge"}}><MDXTag name="span" components={components} parentName="a" props={{"className":"icon-link"}}>{`#`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>{`Preview your build online via Surge`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`You can use the steps below to put the latest build of your app online and share access to it (available only for React Web projects).`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="ol" components={components}>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ol">{`Go to `}<MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="li" props={{"href":"https://surge.sh/"}}>{`Surge`}</MDXTag>{` and create your free account. Password protected builds are available under paid plan.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ol">{`Run `}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="li">{`yarn build`}</MDXTag>{` to create the latest build.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ol">{`Run `}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="li">{`surge -p build`}</MDXTag>{` to put it online.`}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h2" components={components} props={{"id":"use-views-tools-code-and-wysiwyg-editor-for-designers"}}><MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="h2" props={{"aria-hidden":true,"href":"#use-views-tools-code-and-wysiwyg-editor-for-designers"}}><MDXTag name="span" components={components} parentName="a" props={{"className":"icon-link"}}>{`#`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>{`Use Views Tools (code and WYSIWYG editor for designers)`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`Reach out to `}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="p">{`@views-tom`}</MDXTag>{` in via our Slack Team to enroll for a pilot of beta
tools.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`Views Tools are designed to minimise the learning curve for non-developers, and include:`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h3" components={components} props={{"id":"design-system-window"}}><MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="h3" props={{"aria-hidden":true,"href":"#design-system-window"}}><MDXTag name="span" components={components} parentName="a" props={{"className":"icon-link"}}>{`#`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>{`Design System Window`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`Look inside of your React project folder. Browse and access all components in a
visual way to easily determine the state of your Design System.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h3" components={components} props={{"id":"live-preview"}}><MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="h3" props={{"aria-hidden":true,"href":"#live-preview"}}><MDXTag name="span" components={components} parentName="a" props={{"className":"icon-link"}}>{`#`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>{`Live Preview`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`After every change, the live preview shows what your users will see.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h3" components={components} props={{"id":"composer"}}><MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="h3" props={{"aria-hidden":true,"href":"#composer"}}><MDXTag name="span" components={components} parentName="a" props={{"className":"icon-link"}}>{`#`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>{`Composer`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`Use the layout composer to reason about the structure of a view. Drag and drop,
add in place and reorder blocks - Trello style. Take advantage of Atomic Design
nesting patterns for great reusability and control.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h3" components={components} props={{"id":"props-panel"}}><MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="h3" props={{"aria-hidden":true,"href":"#props-panel"}}><MDXTag name="span" components={components} parentName="a" props={{"className":"icon-link"}}>{`#`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>{`Props Panel`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`Align with Flex, tweak typography, adjust white space, pick the right colours,
use dynamic slots, images and SVGs. Gain full creative control with the use of
straightforward CSS-like properties.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`We aim to release first public version of Tools after finishing testing phase in
the first quarter of 2018.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h2" components={components} props={{"id":"more-or-less-convenient-questions-and-answers"}}><MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="h2" props={{"aria-hidden":true,"href":"#more-or-less-convenient-questions-and-answers"}}><MDXTag name="span" components={components} parentName="a" props={{"className":"icon-link"}}>{`#`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>{`More, or less, convenient questions and answers`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h3" components={components} props={{"id":"about-the-benefits"}}><MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="h3" props={{"aria-hidden":true,"href":"#about-the-benefits"}}><MDXTag name="span" components={components} parentName="a" props={{"className":"icon-link"}}>{`#`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>{`About the benefits`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="ol" components={components}>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ol">{`How my distributed teams can benefit from Views?`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ol">{`What about other designers, those who don't have front-end experience, how can they contribute?`}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}><MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="p" props={{"href":"https://vimeo.com/250934086","title":"Quick overview of how to implement a feature in Views"}}><MDXTag name="img" components={components} parentName="a" props={{"src":"FAQTools1.png","alt":"Quick overview of how to implement a feature in Views"}}></MDXTag></MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h3" components={components} props={{"id":"out-of-experimental-phase"}}><MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="h3" props={{"aria-hidden":true,"href":"#out-of-experimental-phase"}}><MDXTag name="span" components={components} parentName="a" props={{"className":"icon-link"}}>{`#`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>{`Out of experimental phase`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`QUESTION: The topmost concern is that the entire thing looks rather experimental, implies certain workflows, and at the same time - rather opinionated and intrusive (both project-structure-wise and dev-workflow).`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`ANSWER:`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="ul" components={components}>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`We are are getting out of the experimental stage as we test Views with selected partners. We lead the change in product delivery space towards inclusion, transparency, and open participation. At the same time, we set new best practices in place where until now there were separate agendas and silos. The way we build products has to change, and its changing as we speak. We have a unique opportunity to be part of this success story.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Yes, Views has a specific workflow for designers and developers focused on collaboration.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Other than having logic files to control the view file next to each other, there are no other structural requirements.`}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h3" components={components} props={{"id":"we-optimize-for-both-designers-and-developers"}}><MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="h3" props={{"aria-hidden":true,"href":"#we-optimize-for-both-designers-and-developers"}}><MDXTag name="span" components={components} parentName="a" props={{"className":"icon-link"}}>{`#`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>{`We optimize for both: designers and developers`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`QUESTION: The other big concern is syntax - while terse its rather unreadable, you can't "scan" it and immediately understand the structure (as opposed to HTML/JSX). That might save some keystrokes but devs spend way more time reading the code than writing it. Well, maybe there are other reasons behind this syntax. At least minimal indentation would help already.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`ANSWER:`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="ul" components={components}>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Syntax highlighting for Sublime, Atom, Code, VIM helps readability`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`We recommend to use Composer to reason about the structure of the UI (its one of the tools in Views Tools package)`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`If indentation is absolutely required we are open to work with you to make it happen in the open source morpher `}<MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="li" props={{"href":"https://github.com/viewstools/morph"}}>{`https://github.com/viewstools/morph`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h3" components={components} props={{"id":"advanced-development-features-are-on-the-roadmap"}}><MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="h3" props={{"aria-hidden":true,"href":"#advanced-development-features-are-on-the-roadmap"}}><MDXTag name="span" components={components} parentName="a" props={{"className":"icon-link"}}>{`#`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>{`Advanced development features are on the roadmap`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`QUESTION: Another related concern is a custom format/language/DSL in general. Aside from the need to learn and understand the new syntax, there's not IDE/editor support, autocomplete, type-checking, linting, Prettier formatting, etc. UPDATE: Yeah, there are popular editors' extensions being developed but GitHub doesn't understand that, and it's definitely below the line compared to JS/TS`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`ANSWER:`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="ul" components={components}>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Typescript integration is possible `}<MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="li" props={{"href":"https://github.com/lyft/react-javascript-to-typescript-transform"}}>{`https://github.com/lyft/react-javascript-to-typescript-transform`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Regarding Github support `}<MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="li" props={{"href":"https://github.com/github/linguist/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#adding-a-language"}}>{`https://github.com/github/linguist/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#adding-a-language`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Linting on text editors is on our roadmap. More info `}<MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="li" props={{"href":"https://github.com/viewstools/morph/issues/19"}}>{`https://github.com/viewstools/morph/issues/19`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`You (an engineer) would mostly write logic (prue JS of your choice) and sometimes help a designer understand the technical aspects of the view structure, especially when very complex components are in use, i.e. drag and drop, recursive structures (which are basic for any developer to grasp). You wont be writing Views code. Thats my (a designers) responsibility.`}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h3" components={components} props={{"id":"easy-in-easy-out"}}><MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="h3" props={{"aria-hidden":true,"href":"#easy-in-easy-out"}}><MDXTag name="span" components={components} parentName="a" props={{"className":"icon-link"}}>{`#`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>{`Easy in, easy out`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`QUESTION: Not clear what is the integration workflow (i.e., embedding Views-driven components into existing React app), is it a compiled version of component being added to the project? Is "Views" an all-or-nothing kind of thing?`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`ANSWER:
`}<MDXTag name="img" components={components} parentName="p" props={{"src":"ProjectStructure.jpg","alt":"Views Project Structure"}}></MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h3" components={components} props={{"id":"your-project-your-folder-structure"}}><MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="h3" props={{"aria-hidden":true,"href":"#your-project-your-folder-structure"}}><MDXTag name="span" components={components} parentName="a" props={{"className":"icon-link"}}>{`#`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>{`Your project, your folder structure`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`QUESTION: Synthetic limitations. Like one block in a file - sometimes, its rather convenient to define few private glamorous/styled-components/whatever-else-CSS-in-JS components right in the same file, those are getting composed into a single  export ed component then. You can then generalize/extract these sub-components at will without changing the original component's public contract.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`ANSWER:`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="ul" components={components}>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Views recognizes files in the project despite where they are in the folders. If you want to group things, eg, put all buttons into a Buttons folder.`}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h3" components={components} props={{"id":"there-is-logic-to-logic-files"}}><MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="h3" props={{"aria-hidden":true,"href":"#there-is-logic-to-logic-files"}}><MDXTag name="span" components={components} parentName="a" props={{"className":"icon-link"}}>{`#`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>{`There is logic to logic files`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`QUESTION: The default React component contract is preserved but is assumed to be a conceptually different thing. The component is component, whatever that is. Why would the regular wrapping component (a new component that is created and wraps over "Views" component) have the .view.logic.js suffix? Its still full-blown React component, not necessarily a "logic" or "extension", right?`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`ANSWER:`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="ul" components={components}>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`We are open to changing the extension of the logic file. Therefore, the name `}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="li">{`.view.logic.js`}</MDXTag>{` was used to reinforce the pattern that the view has logic attached to it. If that file exists, Views picks it up instead of the view.js when it is required by another view.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Logic files are not always required for each view, team can make other implementation choices. You can pass props (we call them slots in Views syntax, but they are props) across like in any React application and choose where your logic lives.`}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h3" components={components} props={{"id":"use-third-party-components-via-js"}}><MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="h3" props={{"aria-hidden":true,"href":"#use-third-party-components-via-js"}}><MDXTag name="span" components={components} parentName="a" props={{"className":"icon-link"}}>{`#`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>{`Use third party components via JS`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`QUESTION: Manual boilerplate to integrate the existing ready-to-use 3rd-party component (I know this will be addressed at some point, but in the current implementation its kinda diminishes the purpose - since we write the terse view first, but are inclined to have a "wiring" file for every external component).`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`ANSWER:`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="ul" components={components}>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`This is a pattern that other languages, like ReasonML, are using to integrate with third party packages. Were open to a better way of handling this. Most times you shouldnt need lots of custom/external views, the connection to npm packages would generally be in your own logic.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Views supports `}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="li">{`.js`}</MDXTag>{` files with a `}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="li">{`// @view`}</MDXTag>{` pragma as a way to tell Views that the file is a custom/fake view.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`This point in docs expands on the subject `}<MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="li" props={{"href":"https://github.com/viewstools/docs#views-and-your-react-components"}}>{`https://github.com/viewstools/docs#views-and-your-react-components`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h3" components={components} props={{"id":"views-files-are-responsible-for-composition-and-styling-as-well-as-the-advanced-styling-with-scopes"}}><MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="h3" props={{"aria-hidden":true,"href":"#views-files-are-responsible-for-composition-and-styling-as-well-as-the-advanced-styling-with-scopes"}}><MDXTag name="span" components={components} parentName="a" props={{"className":"icon-link"}}>{`#`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>{`Views files are responsible for composition and styling (as well as, the advanced styling with scopes)`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`QUESTION: The overall approach somewhat encourages mixing style properties with data/behavior properties.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`ANSWER:`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="ul" components={components}>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Views expresses UI and UX, and doesnt dictate what happens when a button is clicked, and you change your data. Thats the responsibility of the logic file and its dependencies.`}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h3" components={components} props={{"id":"views-scopes-enter-the-next-implementation-stage"}}><MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="h3" props={{"aria-hidden":true,"href":"#views-scopes-enter-the-next-implementation-stage"}}><MDXTag name="span" components={components} parentName="a" props={{"className":"icon-link"}}>{`#`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>{`Views scopes enter the next implementation stage`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`QUESTION: CSS combinators, pseudo-classes, media-queries, animations somehow?`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`ANSWER:`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="ul" components={components}>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Some pseudo classes like hover and focus are supported. The rest can be done through scopes.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`We are planning media queries through scopes too.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Animations are done for React Web through CSS transitions.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`In Native, you can use animated through JS and the implementation on the roadmap `}<MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="li" props={{"href":"https://trello.com/b/NhIKKbol/views-roadmap"}}>{`https://trello.com/b/NhIKKbol/views-roadmap`}</MDXTag>{`.`}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h3" components={components} props={{"id":"viewjs-is-auto-generated-and-shouldnt-be-edited"}}><MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="h3" props={{"aria-hidden":true,"href":"#viewjs-is-auto-generated-and-shouldnt-be-edited"}}><MDXTag name="span" components={components} parentName="a" props={{"className":"icon-link"}}>{`#`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>{`.view.js is auto-generated and shouldn't be edited`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`QUESTION: I ran views-morph on my project, and it created a bunch of other files, what's going on?`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`ANSWER:
Say you have a View called `}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="p">{`My.view`}</MDXTag>{`. When morphing it, Views will create a file
called `}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="p">{`My.view.js`}</MDXTag>{`. You can safely ignore `}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="p">{`.view.js`}</MDXTag>{` files as they'll be created on the
fly when the morpher runs and your changes will be overwritten.`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
